subject: PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Earnings including Ansell, Aurizon, GPT, Korea Gas and LG Corp; Japan is shut for Mountain Day
content:
AUSTRALIA

AGL Energy (AGL AT) - Trevor St Baker is said to be interested in Co.’s Liddell asset. (Newswires)

Ansell (ANN AT) - Co. FY19 Adj. net AUD 150.9mln vs. Prev. AUD 146.7mln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Aurizon Holdings (AZJ AT) - Co. FY19 Adj. net AUD 473.3mln vs. Prev. AUD 542mln Y/Y, to buyback AUD 300mln of shares and will sell rail grinding business to Loram for AUD 186mln. (Newswires)                                                         

Australian Finance Group (AFG AT) - Co. is to merge with Connective for AUD 120mln. (Newswires)

Bendigo and Adelaide Bank (BEN AT) - Co. FY19 cash profit AUD 415.7mln vs. Prev. AUD 445.1mln Y/Y, rev. AUD 1.57bln vs. Prev. AUD 1.64bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Fonterra (FSF AT) - Co. affirms FY19 underlying EPS NZD 0.10-0.15, but expects a reported loss of between NZD 590mln-675mln this year after likely writedowns and will not pay a dividend in FY19. (Newswires)

GPT Group (GPT AT) - Co. reports H1 FFO AUD 295.9mln vs. Prev. AUD 289.4mln, net fell 51.6% Y/Y to AUD 352.6mln, rev. rose 31.8% Y/Y to AUD 645.2mln. (Newswires)

JB Hi-Fi (JBH AT) - Co. FY19 net AUD 249.8mln vs. Exp. AUD 243.0mln, rev. AUD 7.1bln vs. Exp. AUD 7.1bln, Co. declares final dividend AUD 0.51 per security and said its                                                                                               July sales growth for Australia business was at 4.1% vs. Prev. 2.9% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Macquarie Media (MRN AT) - Co. board recommends offer from Nine Entertainment (NEC AT). (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Korea Gas (036460 KS) - Co. Q1 net loss KRW 12.4bln vs. Exp. loss KRW 25.8bln. (Newswires)

LG Corp (003550 KS) - Co. Q2 net KRW 515.7bln vs. Exp. KRW 468.9bln, rev. KRW 1.62tln vs. Prev. 1.91tln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS) - Co. began sourcing extreme ultraviolet photo resist used in chip-making from a Belgian company. (Newswires)

Geopolitics

North Korea fired another 2 projectiles into the East China Sea on Saturday, while it threatened to freeze any future talks with South Korea and only hold them with the US in retaliation to US-South Korea military drills. (Newswires)

US President Trump said he received a beautiful letter from North Korean Leader Kim and thinks he will have another meeting with the leader, while Kim was said to have complained about military exercises in the letter and said that missile tests will end when military exercises end. (Newswires)

subject: UK opposition Labour MPs have been told to cancel travel plans for next month as party leader Corbyn prepares to table a no-confidence motion
New Zealand Electronic Card Retail Sales (Jul) M/M -0.1% vs. Exp. 0.6% (Prev. 0.0%)
New Zealand Electronic Card Retail Sales (Jul) Y/Y 1.6% vs. Exp. 2.2% (Prev. 1.1%)
The only functioning airport in Tripoli, Libya was struck by rocket fire from rebel forces
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include very light calendar amid several holiday closures
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump said September talks with China may be cancelled, while he earlier stated that the US is doing very well and still talking to China but is not going to make a deal right now. Trump also commented we will not be doing business with Huawei but this may change in the event of a US-China trade deal. (Newswires/CNBC)

China chartered its first US crude cargo since the most recent tariff threat from US President Trump, according to sources. (Newswires)

China PBOC Q2 monetary policy implementation report pledged to keep monetary policy prudent with a proper balance and said It will guide financial institutions to increase medium to long-term investment in manufacturing and private firms. Furthermore, the PBoC will continue to use multiple monetary policy tools and keep the yuan basically stable, as well as deepen market-based interest rate reform. (Newswires)

Indian Industrial Output (Jun) Y/Y 2.0% vs. Exp. 1.5% (Prev. 3.1%, Rev. 4.6%). (Newswires)

 

UK/EU

UK PM Johnson was said to be developing plans for a bailout fund to support businesses in the occurrence of a no-deal Brexit. (Newswires)

Italy Deputy PM and League leader Salvini said that if he wins elections, taxes will be cut regardless of EU opinion. There were also reports that the Italian Senate will meet on Monday to set a date for holding a no-confidence vote against the government. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Italy at 'BBB'; Outlook Negative and raised Russia to 'BBB'; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

  • UK GDP (Q2 P) Q/Q -0.2% Exp. 0.0% (Prev. 0.5%); first quarterly contraction since 2012. (Newswires)
  • UK GDP (Q2 P) Y/Y 1.2% vs. Exp. 1.4% (Prev. 1.8%)
  • UK Industrial Output (Jun) Y/Y -0.6% vs. Exp. -0.2% (Prev. 0.9%, Rev. 0.5%)
  • UK Manufacturing Output (Jun) Y/Y -1.4% vs. Exp. -1.1% (Rev. -0.2%) 
  • UK Goods Trade Balance (GBP)(Jun) -7.009B vs. Exp. -11.8B (Prev. -11.52B, Rev. -10.695B)

 

FX

  • Canadian Employment Change (Jul) -24.2k vs. Exp. 12.5k (Prev. -2.2k). (Newswires)
  • Canada Average Hourly Wages (Jul) Y/Y 4.5% (Prev. 3.6%) 

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (9/Aug): Oil rigs -6 at 764, gas rigs -2 at 169, total rigs -8 at 934. (Newswires)

Russia's oil production increased to 11.32mln BPD between August 1st-8th (Prev. 11.15mln BPD in July), according to two sources. (Newswires)

 

GEOPOLITICS

North Korea fired another 2 projectiles into the East China Sea on Saturday, while it threatened to freeze any future talks with South Korea and only hold them with the US in retaliation to US-South Korea military drills. (Newswires)

US President Trump said he received a beautiful letter from North Korean Leader Kim and thinks he will have another meeting with the leader, while Kim was said to have complained about military exercises in the letter and said that missile tests will end when military exercises end. (Newswires)

Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesperson said any Israel involvement in any maritime coalition in the Gulf is a "clear threat" to national security, which Iran has a right to confront the threat. (Newswires)

 

US

US President Trump said he wants the Fed to lower rates by 1 percentage point and that the USD is the safest but is so strong its hurting manufacturers, while he later commented that he would not devalue USD as 'we do not have to'. (Newswires)

US PPI Final Demand YY Jul 1.7% vs. Exp. 1.7% (Prev. 1.7%). (Newswires)

 

MARKET RECAP

Risk sentiment was sour after US President Trump stated that the US and China were in talks, but he was not yet ready to strike a deal, adding to concerns of a global growth slowdown, and stoking fears of recession once again. Semis (SOX) were hit overnight following reports the White House is delaying the license decision for US companies to restart business with Huawei. The decision comes as China halts US agricultural imports. Trump also stated “we’re not doing business with Huawei” however, the White House later tempered his comments. Tech stocks were also dragged lower following poor earnings results from DXC Tech (DXC), which fell over 30% on Friday as it lowered its FY forecast which led to a slew of price target cuts. Other names lower in the space include Microchip (MCHP), Micron (MU), Nvidia (NVDA) & Xilinx (XLNX). Broadcom (AVGO) traded over 3% higher as it officially announced it will acquire Symantec’s (SYMC) enterprise security assets for USD 10.7bln, while Uber (UBER) were hit after misses on both EPS and revenue, as well as gross bookings. S&P 500 -0.7% at 2919, Dow Jones -0.3% at 26287, Nasdaq-100 -1.0% at 7646.

Treasuries were positive in early trade, on the familiar concerns of slowing global growth, and the reintroduction of political risk in Europe courtesy of Italy, while UK growth contracting in Q2 did little to help. However, in later trade, yields moved higher, leaving the curve slightly steeper, with major curve spreads modestly wider to the tune of 1-2bps at settlement; the afternoon bounce was due to the White House ‘clarifying’ comments President Trump made on Huawei. On the week, the curve has bull flattened (on the week: 2s -9bps, 5s -11bps, 10s -12bps, and 30s -14bps). US T-note futures settled 7+ ticks lower at 129-22.

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
